{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with primary amenorrhea, short stature, webbed neck, widely spaced nipples, weak pulses in the lower extremity, and streak ovaries. These clinical features are suggestive of Turner syndrome. Turner syndrome is most commonly associated with a karyotype of 45XO, which is characterized by the absence of one X chromosome. Therefore, the most likely karyotype for this patient is 45XO.", "answer_choice": "A"}
